summary: The diff implements the majority of the BharatSMM requirements: a Motoko backend actor with service catalog, orders, and balance management; a multi-page React frontend with all six required pages; at least 15 seeded services across the required categories; a dark navy/orange-red visual theme with sidebar layout; and logo display in the sidebar. A few gaps remain: the Add Funds page uses a mock local submission rather than calling a real backend topUp function, backend category filtering is not confirmed in the truncated diff, and the generated logo PNG asset is referenced but not confirmed committed as a binary file.

missing_requirements.requirement: User balance can be topped up via a backend update function callable from the frontend.
missing_requirements.reason: REQ-1 requires a balance top-up update function and REQ-2 requires Add Funds to submit to the backend. AddFunds.tsx handleSubmit only sets local state (setSubmitted(true)) without invoking any actor mutation.

missing_requirements.requirement: Services can be listed and filtered by category via a backend query.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend main.mo is truncated and no listServicesByCategory or category-filter parameter is visible in the exposed query functions. Filtering appears to happen only on the frontend side.

missing_requirements.requirement: Generate and commit the static logo image file at frontend/public/assets/generated/bharatsmm-logo.dim_256x256.png.
missing_requirements.reason: The logo PNG is referenced throughout the UI but the diff shows no added binary or image file at that path. The diff lists 25 added files and none is the PNG asset.

hallucinated_features.description: ProfileSetupModal and full user profile CRUD with name and email fields saved to the backend.
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request only asks for a Profile page displaying the logged-in user principal. A profile setup modal and editable name/email stored in the canister was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Order statuses 'refunded' and 'failed' beyond the specified four statuses.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1 specifies exactly four statuses: Pending, Processing, Completed, Cancelled. The backend and OrderStatusBadge add 'refunded' and 'failed' which were not requested.
